main.name: Derek Etherton
main.description: Lately, I've been doing web development at RBC. My passions include the game of go (圍棋), and elegant software design
main.bio: A solid foundation in software design, algorithms, data structures, and a variety of programming paradigms makes me a quick learner comfortable working with any modern technology. Over a year of working in Android helped me develop some strong Java fundamentals, which I've further improved working with Spring at RBC. I've spent thousands of hours on the web basics (ES6, HTML5, SCSS), received training in Angular 7 and have also built sites using React & Node (like this one). In all pursuits I'm guided by SOLID principles, and keep a design patterns & code smells cheatsheet handy. Yes, I can build "RESTful APIs", and CI/CD is something I can't live without.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: On top of the solid fundamentals that U of T delivers in Computer Science, I was in the first cohort of 10-15 students to enroll in UTSC's Entrepreneurship Specialist stream. With the same stringent requirements of Software Engineering, we had the added benefit of taking a hands-on startup course focused on prototyping a new product in an Agile environment with weekly pitches and demos.

work.title: Developer
work.description: Refactored the design of a robust BI reporting tool built in Angular 7 and Spring, focusing on horizontally reusable code. Successfully separated a tightly-coupled back-end, front-end, and configuration so entirely new dashboards could easily be created with just one JSON configuration file. Also worked with ElasticSearch on the backend. Currently building on this along with a variety of responsive web applications and automated reporting tools.

work.title: Android Developer
work.description: Created an Android kiosk & app for the tourism industry which displays rich 3D map content based on map data pulled from AWS following MVP architecture. Applied Material Design principles with fluid, realistic movement.

work.title: Android Developer
work.description: Created ‘The Rouge’, an app for Canada’s first national urban park, leveraging location services. Features dynamic push notifications, analytics using Google Firebase, and serious performance after months of Espresso automated testing. 1000+ downloads.

work.company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
work.title: Android Developer
work.description: Created a location-aware scheduling application with researchers to aid in the treatment of schizophrenia.

projects.title: McGill Personal Finance Essentials
projects.category: A financial literacy course I lead development for at RBC

projects.title: The Rouge
projects.category: Rouge National Urban Park's official app, developed w/ 3 other students at Parks Canada

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
